name: Emissions Permits 3.0
description:
A revision of EPs, to regulate pollution throughout the Federation. This revision should allow for more flexibility in the allocation of EPs, and will make EPs more dynamic. It will use custom stats instead of a currency and taxation. It will allocate every 24 minutes instead of hourly. It will use the current PPM level instead of 24 hours of stats. It allows late polluters to catch up. It reserves pollution for a district if the Feds need.
Relevant Stats:

Global Stats (tracked via White-Tiger):
EPGlobalAllowed - The amount of total pollution to be allowed per 24 minute interval, calculated based upon current PPM level.
EPDistrictAllowed and EPIndividualAllowed - The amount of pollution allowed within the reserved district, and the amount of pollution allowed outside the reserved district via individual allocation (should add to EPGlobalAllowed)
EPIndividualCount - The sum of every solo or company legal entities EPIndex. It basically counts how many people polluted last interval, with fractional amounts allowed for those that polluted less.
EPIndividualIndex - The max amount of pollution a solo or company legal person will be allotted that interval. Calculated by dividing the EPIndividualAllowed by EPIndividualIndex
EPDistrictUsed - Tracks how much pollution has been done in the reserved district.

Individual Stats (tracked either individually or through company legal person):
EPAllowed - The amount of pollution allowed for that person/company
EPUsed - The amount of pollution in that interval used
EPIndex - Current utilization (percent of max allowed pollution)

properties.Title: Pollution Actions
properties.UserDescription: When a polluting machine is in use, check the relevant allocations against the usage. Either prevent the pollution, or update the relevant usage stat.
